safe_mem.c

00001 /* LINTLIBRARY */
00002 
00003 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00004 #include <config.h>
00005 #include <stdio.h>
00006 #include <bdd/util.h>
00007 
00008 /*
00009  *  These are interface routines to be placed between a program and the
00010  *  system memory allocator.  
00011  *
00012  *  It forces well-defined semantics for several 'borderline' cases:
00013  *
00014  *      malloc() of a 0 size object is guaranteed to return something
00015  *          which is not 0, and can safely be freed (but not dereferenced)
00016  *      free() accepts (silently) an 0 pointer
00017  *      realloc of a 0 pointer is allowed, and is equiv. to malloc()
00018  *      For the IBM/PC it forces no object > 64K; note that the size argument
00019  *          to malloc/realloc is a 'long' to catch this condition
00020  *
00021  *  The function pointer MMoutOfMemory() contains a vector to handle a
00022  *  'out-of-memory' error (which, by default, points at a simple wrap-up 
00023  *  and exit routine).
00024  */
00025 
00026 extern char *MMalloc();
00027 extern void MMout_of_memory();
00028 extern char *MMrealloc();
00029 
00030 
00031 void (*MMoutOfMemory)(long) = MMout_of_memory;
00032 
00033 
00034 /* MMout_of_memory -- out of memory for lazy people, flush and exit */
00035 void 
00036 MMout_of_memory(long size)
00037 {
00038     (void) fflush(stdout);
00039     (void) fprintf(stderr, "\nout of memory allocating %ld bytes\n", size);
00040     exit(1);
00041 }
00042 
00043 
00044 char *
00045 MMalloc(long size)
00046 {
00047     char *p;
00048 
00049 #ifdef IBMPC
00050     if (size > 65000L) {
00051         if (MMoutOfMemory != (void (*)()) 0 ) (*MMoutOfMemory)(size);
00052         return NIL(char);
00053     }
00054 #endif
00055     if (size <= 0) size = sizeof(long);
00056     if ((p = (char *) malloc((unsigned) size)) == NIL(char)) {
00057         if (MMoutOfMemory != (void (*)(long)) 0 ) (*MMoutOfMemory)(size);
00058         return NIL(char);
00059     }
00060     return p;
00061 }
00062 
00063 
00064 char *
00065 MMrealloc(char *obj, long size)
00066 {
00067     char *p;
00068 
00069 #ifdef IBMPC
00070     if (size > 65000L) {
00071         if (MMoutOfMemory != (void (*)()) 0 ) (*MMoutOfMemory)(size);
00072         return NIL(char);
00073     }
00074 #endif
00075     if (obj == NIL(char)) return MMalloc(size);
00076     if (size <= 0) size = sizeof(long);
00077     if ((p = (char *) realloc(obj, (unsigned) size)) == NIL(char)) {
00078         if (MMoutOfMemory != (void (*)(long)) 0 ) (*MMoutOfMemory)(size);
00079         return NIL(char);
00080     }
00081     return p;
00082 }
00083 
00084 
00085 void
00086 MMfree(char *obj)
00087 {
00088     if (obj != 0) {
00089         free(obj);
00090     }
00091 }
